text: The 1933–34 season was the 61st season of competitive football in Scotland and the 44th season of the Scottish Football League. == Scottish League Division One == Champions: Rangers Relegated: Third Lanark, Cowdenbeath == Scottish League Division Two == Promoted: Albion Rovers, Dunfermline Athletic == Scottish Cup == Division One champions Rangers were winners of the Scottish Cup final after a 5–0 final win over St Mirren. == Other Honours == === National === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner-up |- |align=left|Scottish Qualifying Cup - North |Rosyth Dockyard Rec |4 – 1 |Ross County |- |align=left|Scottish Qualifying Cup - South |Penicuik Athletic |3 – 2 |Galston |} === County === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner-up |- |align=left|Aberdeenshire Cup |Aberdeen |7 – 4 * |Keith |- |align=left|Dumbartonshire Cup |Vale Ocaba |3 – 1 |Dumbarton |- |align=left|East of Scotland Shield |Hearts |4 – 0 |Hibernian |- |align=left|Fife Cup |Dunfermline Athletic |2 – 1 |Cowdenbeath |- |align=left|Forfarshire Cup |Arbroath |4 – 1 |Brechin City |- |align=left|Glasgow Cup |Rangers |2 – 0 |Clyde |- |align=left|Lanarkshire Cup |Hamilton |7 – 3 * |Albion Rovers |- |align=left|Perthshire Cup |Blairgowrie |5 – 4replay |Vale of Atholl |- |align=left|Renfrewshire Cup |St Mirren |11 – 3 * |Morton |- |align=left|Southern Counties Cup |Dalbeattie Star | | |- |align=left|Stirlingshire Cup |Alloa Athletic |5 – 4 * |East Stirlingshire |} \- aggregate over two legs === Highland League === == Junior Cup == Benburb were winners of the Junior Cup after a 3–1 win over Bridgeton Waverley in the final. == Scotland national team == {| class="wikitable" !Date !Venue !Opponents ! !Competition !Scotland scorer(s) |-bgcolor=#ffdddd |16 September 1933 |Hampden Park, Glasgow (H) | |align=center|1–2 |BHC |Bob McPhail |-bgcolor=#ffdddd |4 October 1933 |Ninian Park, Cardiff (A) | |align=center|2–3 |BHC |Willie MacFadyen, Dally Duncan |-bgcolor=#ffffdd |29 November 1933 |Hampden Park, Glasgow (H) | |align=center|2–2 |Friendly |David Meiklejohn, Willie MacFadyen |-bgcolor=#ffdddd |14 April 1934Scotland Not in Luck's Way at Wembley | Massie and Gallacher the Big Men, The Glasgow Herald, 16 April 1934 |Wembley Stadium, London (A) | |align=center|0–3 |BHC | |- |} Key: * (H) = Home match * (A) = Away match * BHC = British Home Championship == Notes and references == == External links == * Scottish Football Historical Archive Category:Seasons in Scottish football
title: 1933–34 in Scottish football
